item.title: Hong Kong | Four Activists released after serving time
item.description: Four pro-democracy activists were released yesterday in Hong Kong, after serving four years and two months, as they participated in unofficial primary elections for the opposition in 2020. Former parliamentarians Claudia Mo, Kwok Ka-Ki, Jeremy Tam and Gary Fan were released during the dawn of three different arrests. The safety operation was significant, with nearby police patrols and access restrictions on several roads before the operation. The release of the dissidents occurred after the court discounted the time since they were detained since the end of February 2021, waiting for trial. After attending in court in March 2021, they were denied their request to leave on bail while awaiting trial for “conspiracy to subvert the power of the State”, according to the National Security Act. According to a new law, passed a year ago, prisoners convicted of national security crimes have to meet more rigorous requirements to ensure early release, which makes their release unlikely. This is the liberation of the first group of 45 Democrats convicted in the largest national security trial in the Chinese semi -autonomous region, completed in November. item.title: Horta da Mitra | Inaugurated new staircase with paintings
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) invited local artists to paint a stone staircase in the Horta da Mitra neighborhood, specifically the stairs of Tomás da Rosa Street, right in the center of the Macau Peninsula. The paintings are part of the work with the name “The Roda do Time of the Horta da Mitra neighborhood” and, according to the IC, “enriches the local urban landscape with the portrait of historical changes in the neighborhood over a century”. The guest artists are Lam Ka Hou, Jian Jun Cheng, Liang Jing Siang, NG Ka Mei, Un UT Keong and Ho Kon Pang, and this project was developed in partnership with the Taipa Village Cultural Association. In addition, this initiative “received the support of associations and community representatives”. This mural painted on the stairs describes “various iconic cultural symbols and typical traits” of this zone, such as the Banana and Birds Grove in the past, explaining the origins of the name “Horta da Mitra neighborhood” or cultural events and spaces, such as the Lion market and dances in the TAC FOC Temple. The mural "takes advantage of the gap of steps to create a three -dimensional effect, in which each mirror is adorned with colorful flowers and illustrations, displaying the vitality and human touch of the Horta da Mitra neighborhood." Since 2021, the IC has developed several murals projects in partnership with local artists, thus highlighting “the history of origins [these places] through a fusion of cultural creativity and art”. These murals, located in places such as Travessa da Assunção, Largo do Pagoda da Barra, the outer wall of Nam Kwong warehouses on Almirante Sérgio Street, as well as Travessa da Boa Vista and the ladder of the Taipa, “became famous photography points on social networks for Macao cultural tourism,” says IC.

item.title: DRUG | Five cases involving “oil oil”
item.description:
With the registration of cases of oil consumption of the space to rise to five, the authorities continue to prepare the illegalization of this drug. In addition, the purchase of displeasure tests and other equipment to combat the new phenomenon is prepared
The Judicial Police (PJ) subdirector, I am Sio Keong, said that until yesterday five cases related to oil oil in the territory had been detected. The number was advanced in statements to Radio Macau's Chinese channel during the Macau Forum program, with the authorities promising to take the necessary measures to fight the spread of this drug. Among the five cases detected, all were related to the consumption of oil oil through electronic cigarettes and in two cases the existence of the drug was identified using reagent tests. I am Sio Keong has also assured that authorities are preparing the criminalization of this drug, with the alteration of the legislation, and that they are preparing the purchase of reactive tests and other equipment, so that they can act faster when the prohibition of the new drug comes into force. The drug called Petroleum of Space received this name because users, after consumption, feel they are in space. The main component of the drug is Ethomidate anesthetic. It is an increasingly popular drug in Hong Kong, where it has been prohibited, but there have also been cases of consumption in the interior and in Taiwan. In the neighboring region, the authorities promised a “zero tolerance” policy, with several anti-petroleum advertising campaigns of the space, after three deaths occurred due to the consumption of this saracuous. Frequent changes Prior to Sou Sio Keong's statements, the revision of the Prohibition of Production, Trafficking and Unlawful Consumption of Strepening and Psychotropic Substances had been announced by the Secretary of Security Office, Chang Cheong, in response to an interpellation of Deputy Ella Law. According to the information shared at the beginning of the month, the government's proposal is practically completed, now being discussed within the Executive Council, and then entering the Legislative Assembly. In addition to ethomidate, the new list of prohibited substances will also include metomidate, propoxate and isopropoxate. The proposal must be approved in the Legislative Assembly without difficulties. The latest revision of the drug prohibition and trafficking law took place in summer last year, when the 2-Methyl-AP-237, ethazene, ethonitazepyne, protonitazne and ADB-Bubinaca substances were prohibited. On the fringes of drug discussion, I am Sio Keong also warned of the existence of more burlans, and now using Artificial Intelligence (IA), which can make detection more difficult. For this reason, I am indicated that the PJ has made new alert videos, explaining that the new tools can simulate the voice and image of people known to the victims.

item.title: Portugal / blackout | Macau attentive to student security
item.description:
Macao authorities said yesterday that they are closely monitoring the impact of widespread energy cut in Portugal and Spain due to concerns about the safety of the students at MSAR. DSEDJ recommended that they would be in safe places, maintaining contact with family members
The government of Macao is aware of the impact of the electricity cut that paralyzed the Iberian Peninsula on Monday and in contact with students of MSAR in Portugal and Spain. Yesterday morning, the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) issued a statement to state that "students should monitor official information, prioritize their security and maintain contact with families." Yesterday morning, the body led by Kong Chi Meng indicated that "so far, no requests for students have been registered." Still, DSEDJ has sent alerts by mobile phone to recommend that students remain in safe places and follow the updates of local authorities and educational institutions they attend. Although the supply of electricity has been restored, DSEDJ emphasizes that "the governments of Portugal and Spain declared the state of emergency." As such, if students in affected areas face emergency situations, they should contact the local police or the Chinese embassy or embassy, ​​through the 24 -hour line of the Global Protection and Emergency Service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The same statement also suggests as contact alternatives in open lines for 24 -hour tourism, Macao Economic and Commercial Delegation in Lisbon and DSEDJ itself. Return to Normality A widespread cut in electric supply affected on Monday, since 11:33 (18:33 in Macao), Portugal and Spain, which continued yesterday without explaining by the authorities. Closed airports, traffic congestion and traffic in large cities were some of the consequences of "blackout". The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the center of the country. The E-Redes Electricity Distribution Network Operator reported that until midnight Monday (7 am yesterday in Macau) were partially linked 424 substations, feeding about 6.2 million customers, but cannot predict full replacement.

item.title: Unemployment | Joey Lao relativizes “light climb” of the rate
item.description:
The 0.2 percent rising unemployment in the first quarter of this year does not worry Joey Lao, who considers normal fluctuation and below Hong Kong and Singapore levels. However, the president of the Macao Economic Association warns of the operative problems of small and medium enterprises
In the first three months of this year, the global unemployment rate increased by 0.2 percentage points compared to the last quarter of 2024, setting at 1.9 percent. The unemployment rate of residents had a similar climb, reaching 2.5 percent in the period under analysis. The president of the Macao Economic Association and former Deputy Joey Lao considers that the rate fluctuation, which remains at a level of full employment, is normal. The idea was shared in an opinion published yesterday in the newspaper or Mun, in which the economist argues that, in general, Macau's labor market maintains "good health" and that, therefore, the population need not be overwhelmed by the situation. Despite the slight climb of unemployment, Joey Lao stressed that the global rate remains below 2 percent, a level far lower than that verified in neighboring regions. The leader of the Macao Economic Association gave as an example the unemployment rate in Hong Kong, which set at 3.2 percent in the first three months of 2025. At the same time, the general unemployment rate and the unemployment rate of Singapore residents was 2.9 percent and 3.1 percent, respectively, rising over the last three months of last year. Good bases The former deputy points out that the Macao government has been able to maintain unemployment at safe levels, despite the high degree of uncertainty that affects the global economy and disruption in foreign trade, showing that the economic base of Macao and the labor market maintain stability. In the opinion article published yesterday, the economist shows greater concern about the operative difficulties of small and medium enterprises. As such, Joey Lao stressed that the government has shown that he knows the challenges faced by this segment of the business fabric and therefore release a 2025 bank credit interest bonus plan and support SMEs to reformulate their business and become more competitive. In addition, the former deputy also stated that the government of Sam Hou Fai guaranteed in the lines of government action that, to ensure the stability of the labor market, priority will be given to residents in access to employment.

item.title: Big Bay | Sam Hou Fai considers jiangmen example below
item.description:
The chief executive ended the visit from two days to three cities of the Great Bay, even having passed through his hometown, Zhongshan, who praised due to accelerated development
On a visit to Jiangmen, the chief executive said the experiences of the interior city of China are examples that Macau should follow. Sam Hou Fai's statements were cited in a statement issued by the Social Communication Office (GCS), about the trip of the leader from the large bay. Upon being received on Monday afternoon by Chen Anming, secretary of the Jiangmen Municipal Committee of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), Sam Hou Fai stated that "the city of Jiangmen is well known for their human resources and the historical cultural richness of the overseas Chinese." MSAR political leader stressed that Macau also has a large community of Chinese born outside China and should follow “Jiangmen's successful experiences” to promote this type of tourism. Regarding cooperation between cities, the ruler of MSAR indicated "that both parties can take advantage of the common resources to develop together and create high quality tourist products in the area of ​​world cultural heritage." On the other hand, Sam Hou Fai highlighted the “rich land resources”, Jiangmen 'good transport network ”out of the big bay and a well -installed industrial base that, considered, to create“ a great prospect of full advance ”. Given the prospects for growth of Jiangmen, the chief executive stated that Macau "expects, jointly and hand in hand, to grasp the opportunities generated by the development of the great bay, to enjoy the current deepened base between the two cities, to take advantage of the use of each of the cities" and "create a new chapter of highly qualified development." Other stops Before moving to Jiangmen, the entourage led by Sam Hou Fai stopped in Zhongshan, his homeland, where he met with Guo Wenhai, secretary of the Zhongshan Municipal Committee of the Chinese Communist Party and president of the Zhongshan Municipal Popular Assembly Committee. According to the official statement, Sam Hou Fai stressed at the meeting that Macau and Zhongshan "have a deep connection in historical terms, with frequent contact exchanges" and "have" maintained a friendly relationship. " The chief executive also praised the hometown of having "developed quickly, presenting good trends in progress, both social and economic, with potential cooperation with Macao in various areas." Sam Hou Fai also said "he also hopes that companies in the two locations can grab opportunities and work hand in hand in expanding their business."

item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.title: Studio City | 30 years of the movie “Toy Story” celebrated on exhibition
item.description: The Studio City venture at Cotai presents until October 31st an exhibition dedicated to celebrating the 30th anniversary of the movie “Toy Story” from Disney and Pixar studios. According to a statement, the exhibition space has become "into a Toy Story world, providing visitors of all ages a special adventure with facilities that promise interactive experiences and show unique collection objects." Right at the entrance of Studio City, stands out the six-meter-high Woody character who “welcomes visitors with his characteristic smile”, followed by the giant recreation of the character Andy's bedroom, in the main atrium of the venture, “decorated with furniture and large toys, making visitors feel as if they had shrunk to the size of a toy”. The “Rescuing Woody” installation, inspired by the movie “Toy Story 2”, leads visitors to participate in a search for the character, while “Toy Story Carnival” features “two game cabins and a pop-up store with an exclusive product selection”. Also noteworthy is that the Studio City ferris wheel has five cabins specially decorated in the image of “Toy Story”, with the characters Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Lotso, Aliens and Hamm. Studio City's restoration spaces also provide special menus thinking about the animation movie.

item.title: HSBC | HSBC profit drops 32% until March
item.description: Banco HSBC, the largest in Europe, yesterday announced profits of $ 6,930 million in the first quarter of the year, in a 32 percent reduction in homologous terms when it had extraordinary gains. According to the results sent yesterday to the Hong Kong Exchange, where it is quoted, the group performed above the analysts' predictions, which anticipated a net result of $ 5,390 million. The reduction of profit in the first three months is explained by the extraordinary impact observed in the same period when sales of the activities in Canada and Argentina. Tax -free, the result fell 25 percent to $ 9,500 million, but was also above the $ 7,830 million estimated by analysts. In turn, the financial margin fell 4.6% percent to $ 8,300 million. Quoted in a statement, HSBC CEO Georges Elhedery considered that the results reflect a “dynamics of gains, discipline in the execution of strategy” and “confidence in the ability to meet objectives”. The bank also warned of “increasing macroeconomic uncertainty” due to commercial tariffs applied by the US executive, led by Donald Trump.

item.title: Tourism | Excursionists grow 9.1 percent
item.description: Between January and March, the number of tour to Macau increased by 9.1 percent, compared to the same period, for a value of 550,000 people, according to data revealed yesterday by Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). At the beginning of the year, the trend of most excionalists came from the interior, from where 477,000 tour of the 550,000 arrived, a proportion of 86.7 percent of the total. At the international market level, 60,000 tour, which represented an annual growth of 19.8 percent. In this market, more than half of the excursionists came from South Korea, a total of 33,000, which represented a growth of 43.5 percent. During this period, hotel establishments made a total of 44,000 rooms available, a 5.8 percent reduction compared to the first quarter of 2024, justifying that some of the largest tourist enterprises have been doing room renewal works. The average occupancy rate of guest rooms was 90.1 percent, a growth of 5.2 percentage points. The average period of permanence of guests in Macau remained 1.7 nights, meaning that in this chapter there were no changes compared to the previous year. Still in the first quarter of the year, the number of departures of Macao residents who traveled abroad through travel agency services was 124 million, an increase of 8.7 percent in annual terms. About 31 thousand exits of residents took place on excursions, of which 27,000 had the destination the interior.

item.description: Four pro-democracy activists were released yesterday in Hong Kong, after serving four years and two months, as they participated in unofficial primary elections for the opposition in 2020. Former parliamentarians Claudia Mo, Kwok Ka-Ki, Jeremy Tam and Gary Fan were released during the dawn of three different arrests. The safety operation was significant, with nearby police patrols and access restrictions on several roads before the operation. The release of the dissidents occurred after the court discounted the time since they were detained since the end of February 2021, waiting for trial. After attending in court in March 2021, they were denied their request to leave on bail while awaiting trial for “conspiracy to subvert the power of the State”, according to the National Security Act. According to a new law, passed a year ago, prisoners convicted of national security crimes have to meet more rigorous requirements to ensure early release, which makes their release unlikely. This is the liberation of the first group of 45 Democrats convicted in the largest national security trial in the Chinese semi -autonomous region, completed in November. In an initial decision issued on May 30, the Court of first instance considered the 14 guilty after a long process, which began after Beijing imposed the National Security Act in June 2020.

item.title: Electricity cut affects Portugal, Spain and parts of southern France
item.description: A flaw of electricity affected, at 11:33 (18h33 in Macao), Portugal, Spain and some areas of southern France. In the first moments, information and speculation about the cause of the blackout were disseminated, namely in relation to a possible large-scale cyberataque, a hypothesis that was not excluded in the first instance by the General Secretariat of Internal Administration. Until the closing of this issue, the cause was not yet clear, nor was there an estimate for the return of electricity, but Prime Minister Luís Montenegro said he had hope that the light supply would be resumed yesterday, according to Lisbon time (7 less for Macau). However, there were news in Portuguese media that pointed to the return of electricity in various parts of the country, as well as in Spain. The Expresso newspaper cited data collected by the operators of the electricity network in the Iberian peninsula that pointed to tension imbalances as an explanation for the "blackout" rather than a cyberatheck designed to affect energy infrastructures. Until the closing of this edition, the Portuguese government did not rule out any explanation for the incident. The e-nodes warned that the forecast of electricity replacement remained indefinite and could be prolonged, without advance an estimate. "Given the problems of the network that persist the forecast of energy replacement remains undefined and may be prolonged," said the operator of the electricity distribution network in mainland Portugal, in a statement. E-Redes reiterated that the supply of electricity in Portugal was being affected by upstream constraints of the distribution network, in the very high voltage network in Spain. According to REN - national power grid, yesterday's blackout may have been caused by abnormal temperature fluctuations in Spain. The news was advanced by the BBC, which mentions an atmospheric phenomenon. Pandemonium scenario The incident caused chaos in the country. At airports, check-ins became manuals and began to be announced on flights at first, but were eventually canceled. TAP has issued a statement to appeal to passengers so as not to go to airports, as operation is temporarily conditioned due to blackout. Rail traffic was also totally interrupted throughout the Iberian Peninsula. In the hospitals, emergency generators and emergency services and surgeries have been prioritized to respond to urgent cases. In addition to the Emergency Meeting of the Council of Ministers, the National Operational Coordination Center, which is part of the entities in the context of protection and relief operations, gathered to follow the situation and adopt the necessary procedures due to the lack of energy in mainland Portugal. The telephone and computer systems of the National Institute of Emergency Medical was operating until the closing of this edition using generators and the fuel supply posts interrupted the services. On the other hand, the Águas de Portugal (ADP) group appealed to water consumption only for essential uses, “very moderate”, and said there were only “punctual failures”. Heard by Lusa regarding the widespread cutting of electricity and a possible water failure, the company's official source warned that there may be consumer constraints, although without advanced more concrete data. ADP, which brings together more than a dozen water suppliers on the continent, "appeals to the use of water for the essentials only." "ADP is following the situation in all companies," the source said. The company, he added, intends to ensure that essential services have water and recalled that reservoirs have water but it takes energy to transport it, and that even the buildings themselves need energy to get water to consumers taps.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Facilitated automatic passage from foreign visitors
item.description:
In the presentation of this year's security lines for security, Wong Sio Chak referred to the idea of ​​facilitating the entry into Macau to foreign visitors, with the creation of more automatic passage points
The Secretary for Security announced on Friday, plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors through the use of automatic electronic channels. During the presentation of the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) to 2025 in the area of ​​Security, Wong Sio Chak stated that the territory will extend the use of automatic passage points to foreign citizens without resident or work authorization. To facilitate “exterior exchanges”, authorities will expand autoservice equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, the leader explained. To the deputies at the Legislative Assembly, the secretary added that the government will continue to optimize iris recognition technology in border controls and to study its extension to non-residents this year. "We are also studying ways to widen the number of users eligible for automatic passage channels, allowing more foreign tourists to benefit from faster immigration processes and more fluid circulation in the large bay," Wong said. Speech and company In his speech, the secretary stated that "regarding the creation of a higher level of opening abroad, the input and output services will continue to be optimized and the facilitation measures of the border passage, to ensure a safe, effective, efficient and comfortable passage." Thus, "with a view to promoting the exchange with the outside, the automatic passage channels will also have foreigners, so that they deal with the input and exit inspection formalities through these channels." According to official data, Macau received, in 2024, 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but only 2.42 million were international tourists. In October last year, the Chinese Foreign Ministry extended the Portuguese visa exemption policy, thus inserting Portugal into a list that already covered another 16 European countries. The measure, which allows the Portuguese to stay in China for tourism, business or traffic for a maximum of 15 days, in force at least until December 31, 2025. In the same month, Continental China had announced the expansion, from 90 to 180 days, from the permanence period for foreign residents of Macao on multiple entries in the country. The measure includes permanent and non-permanent foreign residents of Macao that move “to the interior of China for short-term tourism, trade, visit to family members, visits and other activities”. From July, the Chinese National Immigration Administration (NIA) had already allowed foreign permanent residents from Macao and Hong Kong to request authorization to enter the interior of China, valid for a maximum of five years. The measure covers members of the Portuguese community who are permanent residents in Macao and, until then, were required to ask for a visa to travel to the other side of the border.

item.title: April 25 | The Revolution of Cloves seen by the Chinese press
item.description:
The fall of the Estado Novo on April 25, 1974 was reported by the Chinese language press in Macao. Community concerns were revealed, namely about the permanence of the Noble Governor of Carvalho for stability and good business environment, as well as the “status quo” of Macau in the context of decolonization
The echoes of the April 25, 1974 revolution were late in Macao, but this did not mean absence of news in the following days, including the local Chinese press. HM consulted some of the news of the Chinese newspapers of the time over this period, translated to Portuguese by employees of the Press Censorship Commission (CCI), the public body that worked in Macao during the Portuguese dictatorial regime. This material is today to keep the Historical-Diplomatic Archive of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Lisbon. Its reading allows not only to realize some of the events that succeeded the revolution, but also the perceptions and concerns that the Chinese community had on what happened in Portugal. The Chinese wanted to maintain the stability and continuation of business. And if the Noble Governor of Carvalho, in power since 1966, had been, for many, connoted with the fascist regime, and therefore had to leave, the truth is that many wanted their permanence to ensure social peace. As read in the book “Macao in the years of the 1974-1979 Portuguese Revolution”, by Garcia Leandro, former Portuguese governor, “Macao's Chinese sought, above all, stability to be able to continue quietly to their business, and did not want conflicts or misunderstandings with Beijing or Canton”. Administration was “weak, very badly supported technically and to be easily corrupted”, so there were “strong reasons for the local MFA [Movement of the Forces] and the CDM [Macao Democratic Center] want to change, especially for the permanent corruption and the sense of excessive weakness of the Portuguese administration, which seemed nothing to decide without preview of Chinese representatives”. MFA explanations Shortly after April 25, Macau was visited by two MFA representatives, namely Major Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro himself, to explain the revolution and objectives of MFA to Portugal and the colonies, not just to the population but to journalists. One of the meetings, with local journalists, was described by the Tai Chung newspaper on May 6, 1974. "Rebelo Gonçalves received the reporters and narrated them in detail the coup d'état. On the day (of the event), the song" Who sends the people "served as a sign of action." The CCI translator attributed to the song “Grandola, Vila Morena”, by José Afonso, chosen to be the second password of the revolution on the radio, the name “Who Mandates is the people”, in reference to the verse of the letter “The people are the one who orders the most”. The news continued, quoting Rebelo Gonçalves: he said "that the coup d'état was the desire of the people, so it achieved success in the period of one day." Support to Nobre de Carvalho Fallen the regime in Lisbon, and exiled Marcelo Caetano, the issue of the Governor's permanence at the head of the destinations of Macao was quickly asked. However, Nobre de Carvalho received popular support to continue, as described from the news of the newspaper SI Man, October 4, 1974. "Portugal does not intend to modify Macau's status quo, a Portuguese delegate told Chinese traders. This delegate manifests himself pleased with the governor's re-competition campaign, promoted by several social sectors. However, Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho had already requested the dismissal of the position of governor for health reasons." In addition, a group was created “for the collection of signatures in favor of the renewal of Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho in the position of Governor of Macao”, which were handed over to Garcia Leandro, still as MFA official. This one received "two boxes containing signatures-cadenic books." "Opinions of entities of industrial and commercial circles were transmitted, hoping that the governor can remain in Macao, which given his wide experiences and knowledge of conditionalisms, can overcome the difficulties resulting from the economic decline that now happens around the world." But if the desire for many was the continuity of Nobre Carvalho, the departure of many civil servants began to be connoted with the change of regime. As referred to in the news of the Jornal Si Man, May 11, 1974. “The head of health and assistance services, Dr. António Joaquim Paulino, will return on the 27th of this month to mainland Portugal, which is reported to fall from Marcelo Caetano's government. The competent authorities refused to comment on the departure of Dr. Paulino.” The newspaper also added: "However, news from Fidente Fonte reported: It is believed that the unappropriate return to Lisbon of Dr. Paulino, whose service commission in this province has not yet ended, is related to the coup (continental). Still in early May, there were still many questions unanswered, and the newspaper SI Man associated the departure of Vasco Rocha Vieira from the territory, at the time of the military command of the Military Command, with the absence of explanations for the political situation. “A fortnight has passed a fortnight after the coup d'état in Portugal has been fully clarified that the political situation of that country was fully clarified. Although Macau is little affected by the event, the chief of staff of Portuguese troops parked in Macao, Major Rocha Vieira yesterday, which led many people to conjecture and suspect the junta of national salvation. Portuguese government had already started acting in Macau. ” Ho Yin's explanations Tai Chung Pou newspaper reported, on May 22, 1974, that "some Portuguese declared in Hong Kong that they were unhappy with the measures taken by the governor and the government of Macao", followed "for the metropolis to ask for the granting of freedom to the Portuguese of Macao." Ho Yin, a striking entrepreneur and figure of the local Chinese community, who dialogue directly with the governor representing the Chinese authorities, explained in a session with “foreign reporters, as well as those of Hong Kong and Macau” about April events. These “visited Mr. Ho Yin, asking him for opinion,” describes Tai Chung Pou. And once again, Ho Yin appealed his spirits, noting that noble Carvalho had all the legitimacy to continue as governor. "Since the Portuguese coup d'état, registered on April 25, Macau, given its special circumstances, has been felt, to date, very quiet, not undergoing any change. Mr. Governor, General Nobre de Carvalho, who has been in Macao for over seven years, has deep knowledge of the conditions of this city, having resolved many matters through conversations and wrowning great efforts to this city," Ho Yin told the journalists, according to the journalists, according to the journalists. newspaper report. At the same meeting, the possibility of dissolution of the Legislative Assembly, proposal of the CDM, was questioned. But Ho Yin pushed any sudden political change. “It is known that the Macao Democratic Center, consisting of some Portuguese, requested the dissolution of the Legislative Assembly and the Municipal Council [Leal Senate], as well as the remodeling of some public services. Some inhabitants thought that the assertions of that center would affect the social order, but they came to know that they were only the opinion of a small number of Portuguese, when the city is still the city quiet, after a few days. ” The newspaper adds that Nobre de Carvalho publicly explained "that Al would not be dissolved, so the population of Macao became carefree and entrusted in the prosperity of this city." In addition, “tourists from Hong Kong, as well as abroad, also think Macao is quiet and is not affected at all,” read in Tai Chung Pou. The Seng Pou newspaper also reported this meeting between Ho Yin and journalists, in which the Chinese community leader commented on the benefits of a democratic regime. "Given their peculiar circumstances and due to the fact that the Portuguese and Chinese respected themselves and live in peace for a long time, Macau has not suffered any repercussions resulting from that Portuguese coup," Ho Yin said, stressing that "as for the freedom of the word, it has always existed in Macau." However, the entrepreneur appealed to some containment in the political criticism made. "Democracy and freedom that are now verified in mainland Portugal are happiness to the Portuguese people. And the Portuguese and Chinese have lived in the past in peace, and it is expected to continue to succeed in the future. In the then, criticism of private people or public offices must be founded, since any thoughtless attack would make complications to the question, and affect its tranquility and prosperity." Macau without decolonization One of the questions emanating from April 25, 1974 was the most urgent process of decolonization in the so -called Portuguese Africa where the colonial war was due since 1961. First of all, the authorities clarified that Macau would be left out of this process, because “the Popular Republic of China was careful that in 1972, in the UN decolonization committee, to make it very clear that the future of these two European possessions [Macao and Hong and Hong Kong] would not be part of the agenda of the activities of that body, being the subject treated bilaterally, ”reads in the book of Garcia Leandro. In the September 11, 1974 edition, the Tai Chung Pou newspaper wrote that “the head of the Macao Government Office, Lieutenant Colonel Henrique Manuel Lages Ribeiro, pointed out that news emanating from the news agency Reuters had been misunderstood, and that Macau has a peculiar position”, because “the way to solve his future is different from other Portuguese overseas territories.” The words of Almeida Santos are cited, the Portuguese Minister of Interterritorial Coordination, who said “that it would be allowed to all Portuguese overseas territories to choose the form of independence as a means to solve their own problem, with the exception of Macao that, being a very special territory, requires a special way to solve your problem”. In the translation of this news, there is also a note written by the editor itself: "This means that there is no problem of independence in Macau." The visits by Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro Macau took place in “Finals of May, early June 1974. Almeida Santos was in Macao in September of this year and it was at this stage that Garcia Leandro was chosen governor of Macao, taking office on 13 November of this year.

item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.title: Death | Community recalls Pope Francis' dialogue capacity
item.description:
It was 12 years ahead of the destinations of the Catholic Church. Pope Francis died on Monday morning at the age of 88. He also participated in the Easter Sunday celebrations at the Vatican, already quite debilitated. The local Catholic community recalls its legacy of dialogue and management capacity of various crises in the church
Jorge Mario Bergoglio will be forever known as Pope Francis. He died on Monday at the age of 88 hours after celebrating his last Easter before a Vatican crowd. Pope Francis failed to survive the complications of bilateral pneumonia, which forced a prolonged hospitalization for weeks. The news of Pope Francis' dead was the world and the condolence messages and tribute multiplied globally. The local Catholic community was no exception. "No doubt the Catholic community of Macau was very staring Pope Francis a lot, thanks to his smile, no doubt it was a great teaching for the local community. People have always shown a great affection for the Pope," Father Daniel Carvalho told HM. The priest highlighted the fact that Francis was the first Pope from Latin America, more precisely from Argentina, which was "a big news for the church." Contrary to the austere image of his predecessor, Jorge Mario Bergoglio quickly conquered the sympathy of believers and non-decisions for the simplicity and dialogue capacity with various social groups and minorities. "He was a Pope who did not stand out for his intellectuality, but for pastoral work. He proved to be a person of much dialogue, someone merciful, and very close to the simplest, suffering people. He was an extremely accessible pope, showing a side of the church that humanity may not be used to seeing. A nearest, missionary church, open to dialogue." Asked about the future leader of the Catholic Church, Father Daniel Carvalho says it is difficult to point out a possible name for now. "The Catholic Church today has about 120 cardinals, so when the conclave happens there is always an election, and the candidate who gets two thirds of the votes is elected Papa. It is very difficult to get in the figure that will be the next Pope. There are always several possibilities. It is very likely that it is someone from the line of Pope Francis, because many of the current cardinals have been chosen by him. Religion “For All” Stephen Morgan, Rector of the University of St. Joseph (USJ), recalled Pope Francis' words in Lisbon last year during the world's youth days as to the fact that “Catholicism is for everyone, everyone”. "He was able to communicate this, and I think he was also concerned with ensuring that at the highest levels of governance, the church was representative and globally." For Stephen Morgan, Pope Francis “had a communication and connection with people”, and created roots among the Catholic Church in countries in the south of the globe. "Many cardinals have been ordered in places like Myanmar, Timor-Leste or even Mongolia, in a kind of recognition of the global nature of Catholicism, and perhaps it is something in Latin America, from the global southern America, could promote." Over the course of 12 years of pontificate, Pope Francis approached the LGBT community and had to deal with the scandal of sexual abuse within the church. Francisco's position in this field is another point highlighted by Stephen Morgan. "He has done a huge number of things in terms of the church's internal governance, creating mechanisms of liability. I am not sure if the liability has already happened, but these mechanisms, in the crisis of sexual abuse or management of church goods, were really very important. He had an ability to relate to" modern "people because of his informal style," said the USJ rector. As for the future leadership of the Catholic Church, Stephen Morgan also says there are still many possibilities open, taking into account the high number of papal voters. Moreover, "one of the characteristics of this Pope's pontificate was the fact that he did not meet with cardinals many times, and his predecessors tend to meet with the cardinals much more often." "Pope Francis did not do so, so they do not truly know themselves. It can be a very short conclave, with most to say," I know no one, but I know this person. "It may be Tolentino Mendonça, for example. It can take a long time to know each other," he explained. According to Al Jazeera, in January this year there were 252 cardinals, and 138 have election power of the new leader of the Catholic Church. The new Pope will comply with the 267th pontificate. There are several names that may succeed Francis: In addition to the Portuguese Tolentino Mendonça, there is the Cardinals Peter Erddo, Pietro Parolin, Cardinal Secretary of State; Peter Turkson, from Ghana; Luís Tagle, from the Philippines; Mário Grech and Matteo Zuppi. “It is worth mentioning that about 50 percent of the current cardinals come from the global south. Therefore, the idea that the new Pope can be an Asian or African, not a Latin American, is high. But who knows?” He leaves in the air Stephen Morgan. Next journey Pope Francis' funeral will be held within nine days and the conclave to elect his successor within a month, the Vatican announced yesterday after the pontiff's death. This Sunday, Francisco was able to speak, sitting in a wheelchair, in the context of the “Urbi et Orbi” Blessing ceremony: “Urbi”, as it is directed to Rome, and “Orbi”, also directing itself to the whole world. In his message, he deals with an advisor, he denounced the “despicable humanitarian situation” in Gaza, and an appeal was made to ceasefire. Pope Francis also warned of "the climate of growing anti -Semitism that is spreading around the world." "I appeal to belligerents to cease fire, liberate hostages and give precious help to hungry people who yearn for a future of peace," Francisco said in the message. "Pope Francis' self-determined mission was to transform the Catholic Church into a 'campaign hospital' to meet the people where they are, without judging them, healing them with free remedies. So many Catholics loved him deeply," said Stephen Morgan. The Diocese of Macau yesterday issued an official note about the Pope's death, recalling that he "was called to his father's house at the Vatican in Rome at the age of 88." “Throughout his earthly ministry, Pope Francis ardently proclaimed the infinite mercy of God, sowed hope among the faithful, traveled many lands and took care of the most fragile, becoming an exemplary model of pastoral leadership,” is referred to in the note, following a comment by Bishop Stephen Lee. “In this sacred time of the eighth of Easter, Dom Stephen Lee, Bishop of Macau, along with all the brothers and sisters in Christ, raises fervent prayers by the eternal rest of Pope Francis' soul and that he may be received in the glory of the heavenly kingdom. mourning ”, is referred to. The diocese says it will announce the memorial ceremonies of Francisco's death. The note also accounts for the chronology of Francisco's life, namely the birth, on December 17, 1936, in Buenos Aires, with the name of Jorge Mario Bergoglio; and the entrance to the Jesuits in 1958, having been ordered priest in 1969. In 2001 he was ordered cardinal, and about 12 years later he was chosen as a Pope. Beijing condolences China yesterday presented condolences for the death of Pope Francis at the age of 88, and said he intends to continue to develop his relations with the Vatican. Francisco was the first South American and Jesuit Pope in history. "China presents its condolences for the death of Pope Francis," said Guo Jiakun, spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference. The Holy See and China do not maintain official diplomatic relations, since the Vatican is one of about ten countries that recognize Taiwan. However, in 2018, the Pontificate of Francisco signed a historic agreement with the Chinese government about the complex question of the appointment of Catholic bishops in China. "In recent years, China and Vatican have kept constructive contacts and friendly exchanges," said Guo Jiakun. "China is willing to make joint efforts with the Vatican to promote continuous improvement of relationships," he said.

item.title: Countries react to the death of Pope Francis at the age of 88
item.description: Pope Francis died yesterday at 7:35 am, European time, at the home of Santa Marta's house in the Vatican. The 88 -year -old Catholic Church leader had recently been in serious condition for complications of bilateral pneumonia, but recovered in time to be present at Easter Sunday celebrations at the Vatican. However, several country leaders reacted to the death of Francis, one of them the president of Timor-Leste, José Ramos-Horta. Quoted by Lusa, Ramos-Horta said that it was not only the Catholics who lost with the death of Pope Francis, but all religions and humanity. "All religions, all humanity, lost someone of great importance," said President Timorese, in a video message in Tetum, from Sofia, Bulgaria, where he is on an official visit. In the message, the Nobel Peace Nobel Prize, considers that "Pope Francis was one of the most impact on the history of the world," which "embraced the poor, the fragile." "A Pope who did not hesitate to speak against the world powers that promote war instead of peace," said Ramos-Horta, noting that Francis also denounced the powers that ignore the poor and explore the weak. Timorese head of state also recalled Pope Francis' words when he finished a visit to Dili in September 2024. "He held in my hand and said to take good care of this dear people," he recalled. One of the last trips made by Pope Francis was Timor-Leste during which he met with the Timorese President with the religious authorities, civil society, and a diplomatic corps accredited in the country. The Timorese asked to continue to build and consolidate the country's institutions to "be completely able to serve the people of Timor-Leste" and that "citizens are actually represented." "The faith that has enlightened and sustained in the past continue to inspire your gift and your future," said the Pope, remembering that now Timor-Leste has a "new horizon, with clean sky, but with new challenges to face and new problems to solve." India reacted Another political leader who reacted to the Pope's death was Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who pointed out Francis as "example of compassion, humility and courage." "Deeply sad about the death of his holiness, Pope Francis. In this moment of pain and memory, I convey my sincere condolences to the world Catholic community," said Narendra Modi on social networks. "Pope Francis will always be remembered as an example of compassion, humility, and spiritual courage by millions of people around the world. Since a young age, he has dedicated himself to realizing the ideals of Christ. It diligently served the poor and the oppressed," he added. Modi followed his message with several photographs taken during a meeting with Francis, showing the two hugging, and thanked him for the “affection for the people of India”, where about 26 million Christians reside. The Indian leader had several meetings with the Pope, the last of which last June, on the sidelines of the G7 summit in Italy. At a previous meeting in 2021, the Indian Prime Minister invited the Argentine Pontiff to visit India. However, in the US, there was also a reaction to death by the US Vice President JD Vance. “My heart is with the millions of Christians from all over the world who loved him,” wrote Vance, who is currently visiting India on social networks. "I was happy to see it yesterday [Sunday], although I was obviously very sick," he added, quoted by the France-Presse (AFP) news agency. The president of the Philippines, the country with the most Catholics in Asia, today lamented Pope Francis' death and said the Philippines joined the mourning for the loss of the head of the Catholic Church. “A man of deep faith and humility, Pope Francis led not only with wisdom, but also with an open heart to all, especially the poor and forgotten,” said Ferdinand Marcos Jr. in a message on social networks. With over 118 million inhabitants, the Philippines have more than 78% of Catholics and many faithful from other Christian confessions. "Pope Francis taught us that being a good Christian means giving kindness and mutual care. His humility brought many back to the church," Marcos said in the condolence message quoted by the Spanish news agency Efe. "As we regret his death, we honor a life that brought hope and compassion to so many and which inspired us to love each other as Christ loved us. It is a deeply sad day," he added. Manila Cathedral will celebrate a Mass on Tuesday at 09:00 local, presided by Cardinal José Advincula, in honor of Francisco, who became head of the Catholic Church in 2013.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Hengqin will have a center for Lusophone and Hispanic trade
item.description:
Hengqin will have a center to promote trade relations with Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries. The news was announced by the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, in the presentation of the report of the government lines for this year
The government announced on Friday, the establishment of a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages ​​in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in these countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with the norms, training, arbitration and mediation”, said, in the Legislative Assembly, the Secretary for the Administration and Justice of Macao, André Cheong Weng Chon. André Cheong's words, as part of the presentation of the Government Action Lines (LAG) for this year regarding the administration and justice portfolio, meet what government leader Sam Hou Fai, announced on Monday by declaring the intention to “promote exchange and cooperation”, through Macao, China and the universe of Spanish-speaking countries. The Macau Forum was created in 2003 and, more than two decades later, the chief executive decides to extend the focus to Castilian -speaking countries. Cooperation should focus, as indicated in the general presentation of the LAG, among other sectors, in the areas of finance, culture, tourism and transfronic electronic trade. "These are close countries in terms of culture and language, which are part of the Latin world. And we take into account the experiences of the past, culture, the entire political, social system of these countries," said André Cheong. As a toast Noting that the new space has mixed management, from Macao and the in -depth cooperation zone, the official also said that the “Commercial Support Center does not override the [Macao] Forum”. Last week, Sam Hou Fai, Macao's first leader to dominate the Portuguese language, also suggested that he was going to take a visit to Portugal, scheduled for after the Portuguese legislative elections of 18 May, to move to Spain and “start contacts”. The deepened cooperation zone in Hengqin is a project launched by Beijing in 2021, jointly managed by Guangdong province and Macau, with an area of ​​about 106 square kilometers. However, a number of problems persist in this special area, noticed André Cheong, referring “the insufficiency in the development of the real economy, the high rate of eviction of commercial buildings, as well as the lack of circulation of people and commercial activity”. In the second phase of the construction of this area, said the secretary, Macau and the province of Guangdong will reinforce “the interconnection of infrastructure”, “the articulation of rules and mechanisms” and the “approach of residents of Macao and Hengqin”. Iam | Reformation intends to simplify organic structure After changes to the Institute's Board of Directors for Municipal Affairs (AMI), namely the departure of José Tavares from the position of President, here are new changes. On Friday, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, said that "the current institutional organization [of AMI] does not meet the work needs of the institute itself nor to live up to the expectations of citizens", so that this year will be done "the work of restructuring in a phased way". The objective is “to rationalize and simplify the internal organic structure, adjusting the functions based on the principles of centralized management, the reinforcement of coordination and the simplification of procedures, in order to avoid layer management and to increase the efficiency of the municipal management of IAM”. Public function | Birth subsidy passes to 6,580 patacas Secretary André Cheong announced on Friday that the birth allowance for civil service workers will go from index 60 to 70, which means it becomes 6,580 patacas. "The MSAR has adjusted the birth allowance, but not for the civil service, which remains in index 60. We suggest that this allowance be adjusted to 70, equivalent to about 6,580 patacas," he said. It is recalled that the government has also announced, in these lines of governing action, the creation of the childhood allowance, which is expected to reach 15,000 children up to three years old. These children will receive 1,500 monthly patacas, ie 18 thousand patacas per year.

item.title: Unemployment | Joey Lao relativizes “light climb” of the rate
item.description:
The 0.2 percent rising unemployment in the first quarter of this year does not worry Joey Lao, who considers normal fluctuation and below Hong Kong and Singapore levels. However, the president of the Macao Economic Association warns of the operative problems of small and medium enterprises
In the first three months of this year, the global unemployment rate increased by 0.2 percentage points compared to the last quarter of 2024, setting at 1.9 percent. The unemployment rate of residents had a similar climb, reaching 2.5 percent in the period under analysis. The president of the Macao Economic Association and former Deputy Joey Lao considers that the rate fluctuation, which remains at a level of full employment, is normal. The idea was shared in an opinion published yesterday in the newspaper or Mun, in which the economist argues that, in general, Macau's labor market maintains "good health" and that, therefore, the population need not be overwhelmed by the situation. Despite the slight climb of unemployment, Joey Lao stressed that the global rate remains below 2 percent, a level far lower than that verified in neighboring regions. The leader of the Macao Economic Association gave as an example the unemployment rate in Hong Kong, which set at 3.2 percent in the first three months of 2025. At the same time, the general unemployment rate and the unemployment rate of Singapore residents was 2.9 percent and 3.1 percent, respectively, rising over the last three months of last year. Good bases The former deputy points out that the Macao government has been able to maintain unemployment at safe levels, despite the high degree of uncertainty that affects the global economy and disruption in foreign trade, showing that the economic base of Macao and the labor market maintain stability. In the opinion article published yesterday, the economist shows greater concern about the operative difficulties of small and medium enterprises. As such, Joey Lao stressed that the government has shown that he knows the challenges faced by this segment of the business fabric and therefore release a 2025 bank credit interest bonus plan and support SMEs to reformulate their business and become more competitive. In addition, the former deputy also stated that the government of Sam Hou Fai guaranteed in the lines of government action that, to ensure the stability of the labor market, priority will be given to residents in access to employment.

item.title: HKZM Bridge | Foreign crossings rise 70%
item.description:
From the beginning of the year, until Sunday, more than 172,000 foreign passengers have used the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge, a volume that represents an annual climb of 70 percent. In total, more than 10 million people used the bridge in the same period, almost 19 percent than last year
The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge, the world's largest maritime crossing, recorded more than 172,000 foreign passengers by Sunday, an increase of 70 percent compared to the same period of 2024. "This increase is largely due to the expansion of visa exemption policies by China, and Zhuhai's land border post is the only one in the Chinese continental territory that offers direct road access to Hong Kong International Airport," Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. Until Sunday, the total number of trips through the bridge had increased by 18.9 percent in homologous terms, exceeding 10 million passengers, a goal reached 25 days earlier than in 2024. According to Xinhua, the travels of residents in the interior of China increased 30.3 percent to 4.18 million, while the car crossings recorded in Hong Kong and Macao through the Zhuhai border post rose 32.4 percent to almost 1.2 million this year, with a daily average of 10,000, according to data provided by customs authorities. The land in the sea The bridge, which connects the three regions, is the longest maritime crossing in the world, with a length of about 55 kilometers, which include an underground tunnel of almost seven kilometers between two artificial islands to facilitate navigation in the Pearl River delta. The construction of the bridge started in 2009, but was affected by delays, the death of more than 20 workers and budgetary skids. The final cost of the infrastructure is estimated at $ 16.4 billion, more than 25 percent than initially expected. The infrastructure opened in 2018, which reduced the travel time between Macao and Hong Kong by about half, was pointed out by the China government as an important symbol of the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay Integration Policy.

item.title: Economy | Key projects will cost more than 40 billion
item.description:
Sam Hou Fai advanced with an estimate at the cost of the four projects designed to diversify the economy at a press conference exclusively for some local and average means of the Great Bay. The Chief Executive called for young people to “get out of their comfort zone” and seek opportunities in the interior of China
Before leaving for an official visit to Zhuhai, Zhongshan and Jiangmen, the chief executive announced details about the so-called four key projects to diversify the economy, presented in the LAG Lines (LAG) for this year. At a press conference for national media, and some selected places, Sam Hou Fai presented cost estimates for three of the four major infrastructures that will be built over the next decade. The project that seems to have the highest invoice is the city (university) city of International Education of Macao de Hengqin which, according to local press, could cost 20 billion to the public coffers. The project, which will be built on Mountain Island, will advance with the University of Macao at the front, while the “Macao's first higher education institution implementing the pedagogical extension model in the cooperation zone in Hengqin”. The objective is the further enlargement of other public and private institutions of Macao and seek to obtain authorization to build more state reference laboratories. According to LAG, the project aims to “create a pedagogical environment that is uniform with that of Macao, and to configure a Macao Integration Pilot Project with HENGQIN within higher education”. The project of Macao's international and cultural neighborhood is the second most expensive on the list, with an estimated cost of 12 billion patacas. Still without a chosen place, Sam Hou Fai mentioned the Oceanus Park area and the surroundings of the Macao Tower as possibilities. "We have to build something that is iconic in the Asia-Pacific region and even worldwide. It should also reflect the cultural exchange between the West and the East in Macao and promote the main elements of Chinese culture and our historical heritage," said the Chief Executive, according to the TDM Macao channel. The public tender for this project should be launched in the second half of this year, and should last two to three years. The project will integrate cultural, tourist and commercial elements, highlighting the Macao National Museum of Culture, the Macao International Center for Performative Arts and the International Museum of Contemporary Art.
The air from the outside The remaining key projects are the Macao International Air Transport Hub (Porto) on the west bank of Rio das Pérolas and the Macao Sciences and Technologies Industrial Park of Research and Development. For the latter, Sam Hou Fai did not advance with an estimate of the cost. The air transport hub has two expected phases. The first, it aims to increase the capacity and resources in terms of international airlines at Macau airport and the second, to take advantage of cooperation with Zhuhai Airport. This project has an estimated cost of 6 billion patacas. The chief executive also left a message for the youth of Macao, advising the bet on job opportunities in the Great Bay. "We have to get out of our comfort zone and break free from the ancient mindset to be content to be comfortable in our corner. Through Hengqin, we can get into the great bay and understand the global development of the country," said the ruler.
