item.title: LAG 2025 | A quarter of the population of Macau will be elderly until 2041
item.description:
It was up to the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture yesterday to present the report of the Governing Action Lines for this year. LAM underlined the population aging scenario, hoping that up to 2041 almost 25 percent of the population will be elderly, affecting the distribution of public financial resources
The government said yesterday that it provides for a “superb birth rate” this decade and near a quarter of the elderly population by 2041. "In 2029, we will enter a phase of superb birth rate. And with this phenomenon, we can already understand that this will have implications in our work force, our teaching and distribution of our resources," said the secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, when presenting, in the Legislative Assembly (AL), the lines of government action (LAG) for guardianship. Macao registered last year 3,607 births, 105 less in terms, registering a birth rate-number of newborns by a thousand inhabitants-5.3, according to official data. In addition, the territory registered in 2024 a fertility rate of 0.58 children, the lowest ever in Macao. Also known as fertility rate, this is an estimate of the average number of children that a woman will have until the end of the reproductive period. The fertility rate of 0.58 is even lower than the estimate made in a report released in July by the United Nations Economic and Social Affairs Department (UNDESA): 0.68 births per woman. In this report, the Undesa pointed out that the estimate of 0.68 was the lowest in the world. "And all our families support paradigm will also be different," Lam announced, who first went to Al as secretary of the government. The new government, which took office in December, wants to “encourage procreation”, bet on education and strengthen support to families, reinforced Lam. “A lot of work” for doing The secretary recalled that this year will be instituted a childhood assistance allowance, in the amount of 1,500 monthly patacas, for children under three and residents of Macao. The birth allowance “was increased” to a total of 6,500, recalled the official, also referring to the “Medically Assisted Reproduction Support Program”. In AL, LAM indicated that until, at the end of this decade, Macao will exceed “the criterion of super -aging”. And exposed numbers: by 2024, the elderly (65 years or older) represented 14.6 percent of the total population; By 2029 should be 21.4 percent and up to 2041 almost a quarter of the population (24.8 percent). In this sense, the secretary recalled that “there is a lot of work to do”, namely in relation to senior homes. The average waiting time to enter such an institution is 16 months, noted, stressing that more homes will be created, including private.

item.title: Trump and the politicization of time and climate
item.description: The disagreements between Trump and meteorologists are not new. Already in the first administration he directed by him there were disagreements that echoed in the US and international press. Its intrusion in predictions about the evolution of Hurricane Dorian in 2019 caused the “American Meteorological Society” (AMS) and the “National Weather Association” (NWA) to diffuse a joint statement that there would be likely damage caused by the weather in the state of Alabama, as Mr. Trump had vatified. Perhaps for this reason, the then president of the United States of America may have been hating meteorologists and, by dragging, climatologists. Note that being a meteorologist is different from being a climatologist. The meteorologist, among other functions, analyzes the current time and foresees its evolution for the following days, while the climatologist studies the average time of a particular region, or even on a global scale and, using computational models, prepares antevisions of what could happen in the medium and long term, and the period is covered to reach dozens of years. While characterizing time in a particular place or region it is necessary to know the various weather parameters (temperature, moisture, atmospheric pressure, wind, cloudiness, precipitation, etc.) at a given time or a short period, to characterize the climate with the predominant time for relatively long periods. According to the world weather organization, this period should be at least thirty years. Returning to the different between Trump and meteorologists, their interpretation in the functions of these professionals and the institutions where they develop their activity may be the reflection of their vengeful character or by the fact that it is simple, not being able to love the storms (or intensify them), or determine when phenomena such as El-Niño, La Niña, monsoons, etc., should be beginning or ends. On the other hand, with the help of the oligarchs that have gained power in the US, the second country that most emits greenhouse gases (GHG) can certainly influence the climate. As? You can ask. The answer is simple. It is proven that the combustion of fossil fuels (oil, natural gas and mineral coal) is largely responsible for increasing the concentration of GHGs in the atmosphere, the main cause of climate change since the beginning of the industrial age. Since Trump is reversing all laws in the US that advocates the reduction of the use of such fuels, the gee concentration will continue to increase significantly, which will contribute to accentuating these changes. The weather will probably resent the measures being taken, including the cutting of funds in all that relates to the study of climate change and their consequences. The intensification of “drill, baby, drill”, as he likes to repeat, will contribute to the imbalance that the climate is being targeted. The various components of the climate system, especially the atmosphere, the biosphere, the cryiosfera and the hydrosphere will continue to suffer the consequences of the non -accepting of the recommendations of thousands of scientists, through the IPCC, the Kyoto Protocol, the 29 COP (Conference of the Parties) agreement, etc. The atmosphere is increasingly impregnated with GEE, the biosphere is degrading with the increasingly frequent forest fires; The oceans increase in salinity caused by acid rain and the absorption of carbon dioxide; The Criosfera ice fusion rate is increasing, which has the most serious consequence of increasing sea level. The unknown to the current US administration deals with the issues associated with climate and environment is such that, on the Official “Website” of the White House, an “Executive Order” with the title “Reinvigoring America’s Beautiful Clean Choal Industry and Amending Executive Order 14241”, dated April 8, 2025, in which one of the most polluting industries is designated by “Beautiful Industry Charcoal clean". Megha Satyanarayana, chief editor of the opinion section of Scientific American magazine, recently asked "Why is the Trump Administration Politicizing Weather?" In her response, she associates the financial interest with Trump's attitudes and the oligarchy that has gained power. According to her, they are ending the disagreeing voices of the easy and fast profit policy that is based on the exploration of fossil fuels. The ongoing dismissal of scientists who develop their activity in the National Weather Service (NWS), department of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is part of this effort to end the discordant voices of their policy. Hundreds of employees were failed in NOAA as a consequence of the application of the “2025 project”, which is no more than a series of measures aimed at reducing the number and size of state agencies, according to a conservative perspective. In its painful view, Trump administration does not see that, putting into practice this project, it is limiting the efficiency of an institution that has undoubtedly contributed to the safeguarding of lives and goods in a highly efficient way. Based on the information from the weather stations, the weather satellites and communications, the radars, the weather and climate forecast models, weather services are contributing to the prosperity of the countries where they operate. Millions of lives have been saved thanks to meteorological warning systems, based on which alerts about the evolution and approach of highly serious phenomena are prepared, such as tropical and extractic cyclones. item.title: Happiness in Macau
item.description: Executive Chief Sam Hoi-Fai has just announced the government lines for 2025, which contains several highlights: first, 10,000 patacas pecuniary checks continue to be distributed. Second, the pension for the elderly will increase from 3,740 monthly patacas to 3,900, the elderly subsidy increases from 9,000 annual patacas to 10,000, the voucher of the health care reimbursement program rises from 600 patacas to 700. In addition, the childhood assistance in the amount of 1,500 monthly patacas was first atrible. Several social support increased, but we didn't all listed them here. Social support has increased, allowing the beneficiaries to have a better life, which makes everyone happy. Did the government increase several subsidies just because residents so demanded it? The answer is, of course not. Social security systems have created a diverse support network for residents. Increasing benefits increases everyone's feeling of safety: pensions function like a hot blanket, the health system is solid support and the unprotected assistance program is like a long river in helping the weaker. These systems are not dehumanized legal provisions, but the master walls of peace of mind. These master walls try to ensure that everyone can get the essentials. Happiness is not only due to the social security system, but also from people's interactions. This kind of interaction gives us that happiness is waiting for us, and that we can find it for ourselves. In some old tea houses, we often see customers to talk to owners for hours. Owners know that Uncle Zhang wants three parts of sugar and that Aunt Li avoids chopped green onions and prepare the food and drinks in time, waiting for old friends. Do these owners prepare food for the purpose of making money? Of course. What they want is exactly the same as customers. Owners hope to be happy as well as their customers. They all care about each other. The small area of ​​Macau shortens our way away. If we take more than 15 minutes to drive to our destination, we say we go away. But can we think this issue from another perspective? Precisely because Macau is not big, when we left home for a day, the sun still shines when we arrive at Hac Sa Beach. A half-hour car trip drives us away from the confusion and the noise and we give us to a quiet beach. We left footprints in the sand, ate pears and smelled the salty smell of the sea. At night we can look at the stars and talk to the loved one. Another advantage of a small town is that it is full of human warmth. In the morning, during the end-time transport, grandparents who do not know each other, sitting on several lines, tell stories about their grandchildren turning back and forth. These energetic conversations cross the noise and reach everyone's ears. The front row student turns his head with apparent impatience, but the corners of his mouth have an uncomfortable smile - Macao, even when there are "discussions", is a charming region full of human warmth. Macao people also have their serene rituals. One day I saw a man run at a stadium in Macau. He told me that running alone, with no one against who to compete, made him feel extremely comfortable and needed no one else. After running, he let the water wash his fatigue. When he returned the house, he took a shower and relaxed completely. There are numerous interpretations of happiness in Macau: it is the usual soup that the owner of a restaurant prepares for old customers. These are the sweet words of lovers on the beach of Hac Sa. It is the sudden explosion of laughter in the bus. It's someone who takes a bath at home. In the 1980s, the song “Happy” was written by singer Sam Hui. I put below part of the letter: “A felicidade está à tua espera a cada minuto, desde que saibas onde a encontrar.” “Happiness is to look for the stars in the sky, happiness is the foot footprints on the beach of memories.” "Happiness is to leave the city's dust behind. Happiness is to go home and take a bath of immersion." I like to travel. Also, when I have time, I prefer to have a drink. "Happiness is to hum a beautiful song, a afternoon newspaper and a glass of champagne." The government lines have instituted “the childhood assistance allowance”, allowing parents to receive a value of 1,500 patacas since their child is born until they reach the age of three years. To raise a child we need millions of dollars and 1,500 monthly patacas are not surely enough. However, the message that childhood assistance subsidy brings us is not whether 1,500 patacas is sufficient to raise a child, but to allow parents to receive support to raise their children, reducing their financial pressure and allowing them to enjoy “family happiness”. And isn't it “family happiness” a kind of happiness? “Happiness is the disposition that my good woman gives me and happiness is the affectionate kiss that my son gives me. If we can share our happiness with others, we will have a“ happy world ”, it is a world that everyone pursues and longs for. item.title: Horta da Mitra | Inaugurated new staircase with paintings
item.description: The Cultural Institute (IC) invited local artists to paint a stone staircase in the Horta da Mitra neighborhood, specifically the stairs of Tomás da Rosa Street, right in the center of the Macau Peninsula. The paintings are part of the work with the name “The Roda do Time of the Horta da Mitra neighborhood” and, according to the IC, “enriches the local urban landscape with the portrait of historical changes in the neighborhood over a century”. The guest artists are Lam Ka Hou, Jian Jun Cheng, Liang Jing Siang, NG Ka Mei, Un UT Keong and Ho Kon Pang, and this project was developed in partnership with the Taipa Village Cultural Association. In addition, this initiative “received the support of associations and community representatives”. This mural painted on the stairs describes “various iconic cultural symbols and typical traits” of this zone, such as the Banana and Birds Grove in the past, explaining the origins of the name “Horta da Mitra neighborhood” or cultural events and spaces, such as the Lion market and dances in the TAC FOC Temple. The mural "takes advantage of the gap of steps to create a three -dimensional effect, in which each mirror is adorned with colorful flowers and illustrations, displaying the vitality and human touch of the Horta da Mitra neighborhood." Since 2021, the IC has developed several murals projects in partnership with local artists, thus highlighting “the history of origins [these places] through a fusion of cultural creativity and art”. These murals, located in places such as Travessa da Assunção, Largo do Pagoda da Barra, the outer wall of Nam Kwong warehouses on Almirante Sérgio Street, as well as Travessa da Boa Vista and the ladder of the Taipa, “became famous photography points on social networks for Macao cultural tourism,” says IC.

item.title: Studio City | 30 years of the movie “Toy Story” celebrated on exhibition
item.description: The Studio City venture at Cotai presents until October 31st an exhibition dedicated to celebrating the 30th anniversary of the movie “Toy Story” from Disney and Pixar studios. According to a statement, the exhibition space has become "into a Toy Story world, providing visitors of all ages a special adventure with facilities that promise interactive experiences and show unique collection objects." Right at the entrance of Studio City, stands out the six-meter-high Woody character who “welcomes visitors with his characteristic smile”, followed by the giant recreation of the character Andy's bedroom, in the main atrium of the venture, “decorated with furniture and large toys, making visitors feel as if they had shrunk to the size of a toy”. The “Rescuing Woody” installation, inspired by the movie “Toy Story 2”, leads visitors to participate in a search for the character, while “Toy Story Carnival” features “two game cabins and a pop-up store with an exclusive product selection”. Also noteworthy is that the Studio City ferris wheel has five cabins specially decorated in the image of “Toy Story”, with the characters Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Lotso, Aliens and Hamm. Studio City's restoration spaces also provide special menus thinking about the animation movie.

item.title: Fourth edition of “Artbiz Asia” starts next week
item.description: It takes place next week, the 9th, the fourth edition of “Artbiz Asia”, at the Morpheus Hotel, at the City of Dreams, Cotai. The event, organized by the International Association of Macao Culture and Sport Industries and Asian Ir Expo, aims to be “an Asian platform that connects art, culture and business”, and has as its objective “to streamline the role of Macao as 'East Asia Capital'”, describes in an official note about the event. The fourth edition has as its theme “New Exploration on East Asian Arts and Culture”, and aims to look “the deep impact of art on integrated resorts and other related industries”, intending to provide “a platform for artists and leaders of the sector to exchange ideas and explore various roles and potentialities of art and culture in tourism”, without forgetting the areas of technology and urban development. Quoted by the same note, Patrícia Cheong, president of the International Association of Macao Culture and Sport Industries, and founder of “Artbiz Asia”, spoke of this fourth edition of the event, explaining that she intends to “focus on building a dialogue platform for regional tourism decisors and integrated resorts, promoting commercial diversification and the innovative thinking of the artistic industry”. Luxury speakers The event, which aims to look “how art and creativity improve cultural tourism,” explained Patrícia Cheong, brings together integrated resort operators, representatives of artistic entities and art institutions, as well as government figures and even technology and media companies. The idea is to “analyze the potential of innovative models in the level of more sustainable tourism and economic growth, in order to build a symbiosis between art and companies,” it is still read. Helena de Senna Fernandes, director of tourism services, will be one of the guests, followed by designer Alan Chan, who will discuss “the integration of art with urban life”. Also noteworthy is for the presence of Carlos Marreiros, architect and artist Macaense, who will dialogue with Lam Kin Meng do MSAR CULTURAL INSTITUTE AND POPULAR Korean designer Teo Yang about the synergy between heritage, the arts and the revitalization of old neighborhoods. In turn, Ai Lin, director of the Deji Art Museum, will share ideas on the amplification of cultural influence through technology after the world premiere of the “Beeple” exhibition in Nanjing.

item.title: FRC | Recital with UPM students takes place this Saturday
item.description:
It happens this Saturday, at the Rui Cunha Foundation, the “UPM Music Students Set of Music Students”, integrated into the series of concerts “The Sounds of Praia Grande”. This is an initiative carried out in partnership with the Macau Vocal Association that intends to show the talent of local sopranos and the best in music in the territory
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) will feature this Saturday, from 17h, the “UPM Set of Music Students”, integrated into the series of musical concerts “Os Sounds of Praia Grande”, co-organized by Macau Vocal Association. This edition of this afternoon of Bel Canto, a song style, will bring new voices of the music course at Macao Polytechnic University, under the responsibility of singing teacher Wang Xiao. The “Saturdays of Bel Canto” sessions take place in every second Saturdays of the month, with free admission. item.title: DRUG | Five cases involving “oil oil”
item.description:
With the registration of cases of oil consumption of the space to rise to five, the authorities continue to prepare the illegalization of this drug. In addition, the purchase of displeasure tests and other equipment to combat the new phenomenon is prepared
The Judicial Police (PJ) subdirector, I am Sio Keong, said that until yesterday five cases related to oil oil in the territory had been detected. The number was advanced in statements to Radio Macau's Chinese channel during the Macau Forum program, with the authorities promising to take the necessary measures to fight the spread of this drug. Among the five cases detected, all were related to the consumption of oil oil through electronic cigarettes and in two cases the existence of the drug was identified using reagent tests. I am Sio Keong has also assured that authorities are preparing the criminalization of this drug, with the alteration of the legislation, and that they are preparing the purchase of reactive tests and other equipment, so that they can act faster when the prohibition of the new drug comes into force. The drug called Petroleum of Space received this name because users, after consumption, feel they are in space. The main component of the drug is Ethomidate anesthetic. It is an increasingly popular drug in Hong Kong, where it has been prohibited, but there have also been cases of consumption in the interior and in Taiwan. In the neighboring region, the authorities promised a “zero tolerance” policy, with several anti-petroleum advertising campaigns of the space, after three deaths occurred due to the consumption of this saracuous. Frequent changes Prior to Sou Sio Keong's statements, the revision of the Prohibition of Production, Trafficking and Unlawful Consumption of Strepening and Psychotropic Substances had been announced by the Secretary of Security Office, Chang Cheong, in response to an interpellation of Deputy Ella Law. According to the information shared at the beginning of the month, the government's proposal is practically completed, now being discussed within the Executive Council, and then entering the Legislative Assembly. In addition to ethomidate, the new list of prohibited substances will also include metomidate, propoxate and isopropoxate. The proposal must be approved in the Legislative Assembly without difficulties. The latest revision of the drug prohibition and trafficking law took place in summer last year, when the 2-Methyl-AP-237, ethazene, ethonitazepyne, protonitazne and ADB-Bubinaca substances were prohibited. On the fringes of drug discussion, I am Sio Keong also warned of the existence of more burlans, and now using Artificial Intelligence (IA), which can make detection more difficult. For this reason, I am indicated that the PJ has made new alert videos, explaining that the new tools can simulate the voice and image of people known to the victims.

item.title: Tourism | Excursionists grow 9.1 percent
item.description: Between January and March, the number of tour to Macau increased by 9.1 percent, compared to the same period, for a value of 550,000 people, according to data revealed yesterday by Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). At the beginning of the year, the trend of most excionalists came from the interior, from where 477,000 tour of the 550,000 arrived, a proportion of 86.7 percent of the total. At the international market level, 60,000 tour, which represented an annual growth of 19.8 percent. In this market, more than half of the excursionists came from South Korea, a total of 33,000, which represented a growth of 43.5 percent. During this period, hotel establishments made a total of 44,000 rooms available, a 5.8 percent reduction compared to the first quarter of 2024, justifying that some of the largest tourist enterprises have been doing room renewal works. The average occupancy rate of guest rooms was 90.1 percent, a growth of 5.2 percentage points. The average period of permanence of guests in Macau remained 1.7 nights, meaning that in this chapter there were no changes compared to the previous year. Still in the first quarter of the year, the number of departures of Macao residents who traveled abroad through travel agency services was 124 million, an increase of 8.7 percent in annual terms. About 31 thousand exits of residents took place on excursions, of which 27,000 had the destination the interior.

item.title: Dubai | STD promotes territory until tomorrow

item.title: Money Exchange | Detained man with 38 years
item.description: A 38 -year -old man was arrested by the Judicial Police (PJ) on suspicion of illegal money exchange. The case was presented yesterday by the PJ and reported by the newspaper or Mun. According to the information available, suspicions for crime committed when agents saw the man to make a QR code available on his alleged player. In addition, after digitizing the code, the suspect handed Hong Kong $ 15,000 to the player, who left the place of money exchange. item.title: Portugal / blackout | Macau attentive to student security
item.description:
Macao authorities said yesterday that they are closely monitoring the impact of widespread energy cut in Portugal and Spain due to concerns about the safety of the students at MSAR. DSEDJ recommended that they would be in safe places, maintaining contact with family members
The government of Macao is aware of the impact of the electricity cut that paralyzed the Iberian Peninsula on Monday and in contact with students of MSAR in Portugal and Spain. Yesterday morning, the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) issued a statement to state that "students should monitor official information, prioritize their security and maintain contact with families." Yesterday morning, the body led by Kong Chi Meng indicated that "so far, no requests for students have been registered." Still, DSEDJ has sent alerts by mobile phone to recommend that students remain in safe places and follow the updates of local authorities and educational institutions they attend. Although the supply of electricity has been restored, DSEDJ emphasizes that "the governments of Portugal and Spain declared the state of emergency." As such, if students in affected areas face emergency situations, they should contact the local police or the Chinese embassy or embassy, ​​through the 24 -hour line of the Global Protection and Emergency Service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The same statement also suggests as contact alternatives in open lines for 24 -hour tourism, Macao Economic and Commercial Delegation in Lisbon and DSEDJ itself. Return to Normality A widespread cut in electric supply affected on Monday, since 11:33 (18:33 in Macao), Portugal and Spain, which continued yesterday without explaining by the authorities. Closed airports, traffic congestion and traffic in large cities were some of the consequences of "blackout". The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the center of the country. The E-Redes Electricity Distribution Network Operator reported that until midnight Monday (7 am yesterday in Macau) were partially linked 424 substations, feeding about 6.2 million customers, but cannot predict full replacement.

item.title: Chinese exports to Lusophone countries reach record until March
item.description: Chinese exports to Portuguese -speaking countries had the best starter of the year, increasing 2.3 percent in the first three months, compared to an equal period of 2024, according to official data. According to information from China's customs services, released on Monday, goods sold to Lusophone markets until March reached $ 19.7 billion. This is the highest value for a first trimester since the Forum for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries (Macao Forum) began presenting this data in 2013. The data released reveal that the main reason for the new record was Angola, whose imports from China more than doubled, to $ 1.58 billion. Still, and despite a homologous descent of 2 percent, Brazil remains the largest buyer in the Lusophone block, with the goods from China to reach $ 15.8 billion. Portuguese accounts Third on the list, now behind Angola, Portugal, who bought China products worth $ 1.48 billion, more than 1.3 percent than in the first three months of 2024. In the opposite direction, exports from Portuguese -speaking countries to China fell 30.1 percent in the first quarter of 2025, compared to the same period last year. Between January and March the Lusófono Block sold goods worth $ 24.5 billion to the Chinese market. This is the lowest value for the first three months of a year since 2020, at the beginning of the Covid - 19 pandemic. The descent was due mainly to the largest Lusophone supplier in the Chinese market, Brazil, whose sales fell more than one third (34.1 percent) to $ 19.3 billion. In addition, also the second largest Chinese commercial partner in the Lusophone block, Angola, saw exports decrease 10.6 percent to $ 3.87 billion. Similarly, Portugal's sales sales to China decreased by 14.4 percent to $ 635.3 million. On the contrary, Mozambique exports rose 18.5 percent to $ 484.5 million. Equatorial Guinea exports to the Chinese market descended almost a third (32.1 percent) to $ 204 million. Also sales of Timor-Leste and Sao Tome and Principe cringed 97.4 percent and 53.2 percent, respectively, although neither exported more than 3,000 dollars in goods to China. Cape Verde and Guinea-Bissau did not sell any products to the Chinese market in the first three months of 2025.

Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? item.title: Hong Kong | Four Activists released after serving time
item.description: Four pro-democracy activists were released yesterday in Hong Kong, after serving four years and two months, as they participated in unofficial primary elections for the opposition in 2020. Former parliamentarians Claudia Mo, Kwok Ka-Ki, Jeremy Tam and Gary Fan were released during the dawn of three different arrests. The safety operation was significant, with nearby police patrols and access restrictions on several roads before the operation. The release of the dissidents occurred after the court discounted the time since they were detained since the end of February 2021, waiting for trial. After attending in court in March 2021, they were denied their request to leave on bail while awaiting trial for “conspiracy to subvert the power of the State”, according to the National Security Act. According to a new law, passed a year ago, prisoners convicted of national security crimes have to meet more rigorous requirements to ensure early release, which makes their release unlikely. This is the liberation of the first group of 45 Democrats convicted in the largest national security trial in the Chinese semi -autonomous region, completed in November. In an initial decision issued on May 30, the Court of first instance considered the 14 guilty after a long process, which began after Beijing imposed the National Security Act in June 2020.

item.title: Tariffs | China publishes video entitled “We don't kneels”
item.description: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs published yesterday a video entitled “No Kneeling” (“We don't kneel ourselves”), which reaffirms the refusal to give in to the pressures resulting from the trade war with the United States. In the video, published in the Ministry's official account on Wechat social network-similar to WhatsApp-Chinese diplomacy argues that giving in to what he describes as an American “hegemony” would not lead to resolution of tensions, but to its aggravation. The ministry accused the US of triggering a global “tariff storm” and criticized the fact that Washington did not concession to China, such as the 90-day suspension of tariffs decreed by US President Donald Trump for other countries. The authorities compared this dynamic to the "eye of a hurricane", warning that the apparent calm is actually a "deadly trap" that precedes new turbulence. "Historical registration shows that concessions do not guarantee a disagreement in commercial disputes and, instead, end up feeding the increase in pressure," said the country's diplomacy. "Giving in to the aggressor is like drinking poison when thirsty," he described. With a musical background of increasing intensity, the video states that "China does not kneel" and argues that "fighting for cooperation allows cooperation to exist while looking for it through concessions leads to its disappearance." The video also adds that an assertive attitude would allow the smaller countries to be heard, would have potential abuses of power and defend international principles. Fight continues The video also describes opponents to this position as “paper tigers” and points out that US trade represents less than one fifth of world trade, so Washington could be isolated if other countries adhere to China's position. Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi warned yesterday in Rio de Janeiro that "being silent, giving in and backwards" will only make "the aggressor want to take more party," referring to the United States. During a meeting between BRICS Emerging Block Foreign Ministers, Wang said that "the United States has greatly benefited from free trade, but are now using tariffs as a bargaining chip to demand exorbitant prices to other countries." Since the beginning of this month, China and the US have maintained mutual fees more than 100 percent. Although US officials have claimed that negotiations with their Chinese counterparts are underway to reach a trade agreement, Beijing repeatedly denied it.

item.title: Space | Postponement of astronauts due to climacteric conditions
item.description: China postponed the return to the land of three Chinese astronauts that remain six months ago at the space station due to climacteric conditions, local press advanced yesterday. Astronauts, Cai Xuzhe, Song Lingdong and Wang Haoze, should have terrified yesterday in Dongfeng, in the region of Mongolia Inner, northern China, after being half a year in space. The landing was postponed to “ensure the health and safety of astronauts” because the meteorological conditions were not the best, according to the official news agency Xinhua. The three were sent to the Chinese space station Tiangong in October last year, and a new crew of astronauts recently arrived to replace them. During their time on board, the three Chinese astronauts performed experiences and improvements in the space station. Two of the astronauts, Cai and Song, took a nine -hour space walk, the longest ever, during their mission, said the agency responsible for China's manned space missions. The Asian country built its own space station after being excluded from the International Space Station for concerns about the National Security of the United States. The Chinese space program has grown rapidly in recent years. The Chinese space agency has already landed an explorer on Mars and a robot across the moon. Your goal is to put a person on the moon before 2030. Last year, two US astronauts eventually got stuck in the space for nine months after a test flight with Boeing had problems and NASA determined that it was too risky for astronauts to return to Earth in the same capsule.

item.title: BRICS | Xi Institutes Bank of Brics to assume greater role
item.description:
Given global instability, the Chinese president asked the new development bank leader, Dilma Rousseff, to take a more determining role in supporting developing countries
Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday urged the BRICS Bank to reinforce its support for developing countries and to assume a more important role in a global scenario marked by geopolitical tensions and trade war. Xi visited the headquarters of the Novo Development Bank (NDB) during a trip to the eastern metropolis of Shanghai, where he also met with the leader of the institution and former Brazilian president, Dilma Rousseff, said Chinese state press. The New Development Bank - founded by Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa - should, according to Xi, direct their efforts to a new phase of growth centered on sustainability, technology and energy transition, without moving away from their original mission of supporting the global southern countries. The institution “must align with real development needs and offer high quality and low cost financing,” said Xi, who also defended the improvement of the bank's internal management and the expansion of his presence in areas, such as digital infrastructure and green projects. The Chinese leader considered that the Bloc of Emerging Economies represents a growing part of the world economy and stressed that developing countries should have greater participation in the reform of the international financial system. However, it avoided referring directly to specific geopolitical tensions or to institutions such as the IMF or the World Bank. GUARANTEED SUPPORTS Dilma Rousseff has assured that the World Bank will continue to focus on supporting strategic projects in emerging economies and warned against “unilateralism and protectionism”, which has accused “corroding the authority of international law” and “undermining the stability of industrial and supply chains”. In his speech, Dilma also highlighted Beijing's role in a “turbulent” global context, in which “China firmly defends the interests of the global south” and is “an example” in the defense of “multilateralism, equity and international justice”. The former Brazilian president, reelected in March for a five -year term at the head of the organization, thanked the support of member countries and defended the role of the bank as an instrument of multilateral cooperation. His candidacy was proposed by Russia and approved by consensus. The Novo Development Bank, also known as Banco dos Brics, was created in 2014 and began operating a year later, with the aim of offering an alternative funding to developing countries. In recent months, he has extended the number of members with the incorporation of Egypt, Iran, United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia and Indonesia, which formalized his entry in March, after a visit by Rousseff to Jakarta. Bank expansion occurs at a time when the BRICS Group plays a more prominent role in multilateral forums, in the midst of debates on the reconfiguration of the world economic order.

item.title: South Korea | Deepseek returns after reviewing data processing
item.description: The Chinese Application of Artificial Intelligence (IA) DeepSeek returned yesterday to be available in South Korea, after launching a partially revised Korean version of its data processing policy. The unloading of the application had been suspended in South Korea since February 15, after the South Korean government accused its operators of sending user data to other companies without consent. The service revealed yesterday an information processing policy for South Korean users, after South Korea's personal information protection committee revealed last week that DeepSeek transferred personal data from users to three companies in China and one in the United States, without this disclosure covered by their policies. South Korean authorities previously accused the service of sending information to an affiliated company to Bytedance, owner of the Chinese social network Tiktok, and asked the company's owners to strictly establish the legal basis for their data transfers abroad and immediately destroy the committed information, as well as a Korean version of their policies. In its terms and conditions reviewed, DeepSeek has established a separate supplementary regulation for South Korea, which stipulates that it will process personal information in accordance with national data protection laws. Deepseek “will communicate the results of correction and improvement recommendations within 60 days,” said a South Korean commission official, quoted by the local news agency Yonhap.

item.title: Commerce | Tariffs can create the largest black market in the world
item.description: Washington -imposed records imposed on Chinese products can create the “largest black market in the world” as companies turn to overflowing by third countries and subfacting, a Think Tank pointed out. Although US President Donald Trump has set a 145% customs rates on most goods from China, Chinese exports will continue to reach the American market through alternative channels, he stressed in a report to Gavekal Dragonomics, a American reflection group focused on the Chinese economy. The document stressed that the tariff difference between China and the remaining US commercial partners is creating "powerful incentives for dropout," especially through 'triangular trade' and subfaturation. One of the most ways used is to send products from China to countries such as Mexico or Canada, where they are then reatiquitated or slightly modified, to later enter the US as reduced tariffs or exemptions. The so -called minimi regime, which exempts shipments up to $ 800, has also been widely explored. This exception will, however, be revoked for Continental China, Hong Kong and Macao from May 2. The new rules determine that any low value package from these territories will pay a fixed rate of 120 percent of the declared amount. According to the authors of the report, even exporters who do not resort to 'triangular trade' now have strong incentives to sub -face orders. This practice was already significant: by 2021, a US federal reserve study concluded that sub -packing explained more than $ 55 billion of discrepancy between US import data and China exports.

item.title: Tariffs | Beijing considers being on the “right side of history”
item.description:
A high Chinese government official said yesterday that Beijing is “right in history” in the trade war launched by US President Donald Trump
Since returning to the White House last January, Trump has imposed at least 10 percent rates on most US commercial partners and a separated 145 percent surcharge over Chinese products. Beijing retaliated with his own 125 percent surcharge on US products. "China is on the side of the overwhelming majority of the world of the world, the right side of history and human progress," said Zhao Chenxin, deputy director of the National Development and Reform Commission, China's top economic planning agency at a press conference in Beijing. Zhao Chenxin and several high officials from different Chinese ministries have promised Beijing to take more measures to boost the economy and domestic consumption, aiming to mitigate the effects of trade war with the United States. “We are convinced that opposition to the world and truth only leads to isolation. Only moving hand in hand with the world community and defending morality and justice we can build the future,” said Zhao. The United States "practice intimidation and hegemony, constantly reneoking their commitments," he said. On Sunday, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended Donald Trump's tariff policy, which is disturbing the world economy, considering it as a way to create “strategic uncertainty” to give Washington advantage. Yesterday to respond to these comments, Guo Jiakun, spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, said the United States should "lead dialogue with China based on equality, respect and mutual benefit." "If the United States really want to solve the problem through dialogue and negotiation, they should stop threatening and blackmailing," Guo said at a press conference. High voltage Beijing promised to wage the trade war "to the end" if Washington continues with his protectionist measures. However, China acknowledged yesterday that the commercial storm triggered by Donald Trump is having an impact on its economy, which remains strongly dependent on exports. "Although the [national] economy continues to recover, the foundations for sustainable improvement require greater reinforcement in the face of growing external pressures," Yu Jadoong, Deputy Human Resources, said at a press conference. "The successive imposition of exorbitant rates by the United States has created difficulties in production and operation to some exporting companies and affected the use of some workers," he said.

item.title: Tariffs | China decement Trump about commercial negotiations with the United States
item.description: China has again denying it to be in negotiations with the United States about the tariffs, denying the comments of US President Donald Trump on Friday. "There have been no consultations or negotiations between China and the United States on tariff issues, let alone an agreement," the Chinese embassy in Washington said in a statement published on the Wechat messaging platform. The US statements that a dialogue about the fares "are misleading," the Chinese diplomatic representation is underway. item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
item.description:
Graduated in the area of ​​educational technologies, Adelina Moura will conduct lectures to parents, students and teachers about the use of digital technologies in classrooms, within the “Letters & Company” festival of the Portuguese Institute of the East. The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005. The mobile phone can be an excellent learning tool, a means to motivate students and to enrich their learning. We have a kind of Swiss knife here, a very powerful equipment in the hands of the students and there is a school failure, because they do not work and help students enhance this equipment they have. What happens is that students learn in the worst way, in a destructed way, by attempt-rrove. There is a gap, as students are not alerted to the positive potential for mobile phone use. They face their mobile phones as a free time use, spending time on social networks and scrolling, and time consumes. It is essential that teachers are users, in their practices, mobile phones, and for the preparation of classes and other projects, to know how to prepare students. I consider that the school has lost several stages of students' preparation and awareness to use these equipment that lead to classes and with which schools have not spent any money. With the prohibition of bringing the mobile phone to the classroom we did not advance anything in this regard. During the pandemic period, for example, the use of technologies, with distance learning, was quite enhanced. But during the pandemic we also burned some steps regarding the use of digital by teachers, because before the pandemic many teachers did not believe or used. They thought it was a fashion and they saw no use in the use of mobile phones and other technologies. With the pandemic the use of these equipment proved that without them the situation of education would have been much worse. In these pandemic years, teachers have become more aware of the technologies that already exist and are available to anyone. With internet access on mobile phone, something that has existed since 2007 with the launch of the first iPhone, the e-learning system is enhanced and then we move to “Mobile Learning”, where you can learn anywhere and anytime with mobile devices. It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. But it is 30 years of technology where there have been many changes, and technology in fact goes on and if we immediately do not realize what we have available, we and students, we help create a moat that has happened in the past compared to digital. In the face of AI, if we do not look back and do not realize what was not done and should have been at school level, we are wasting time. Only a few years from now will people be alert to AI, and the gap is increasing. Hence it is very important to bet now, in this early stage, in the training of teachers, students and families. Is there much ignorance of parents, removal from this reality? We have parents who are from this century. That is, they were born with the existence of computers, internet, saw the appearance of the smartphone. But when they studied, the school did not talk about the potential of digital. So these former students came to society and did not bring this sensitivity to digital, to educate their children. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. The invitation I received from IPOR seems to me an excellent holistic view of everything, because the school includes several actors, connecting with society. How should AI be introduced into the classroom? We currently watch changes in search engines, in fact. We have search engines created from root to Age Age, for example. The best way to introduce AI into the classroom is to ask students and how they use it, and already resort to this tool. At the beginning of the academic year I always ask students to answer a questionnaire about their digital routines, and then I know more or less their practices. In 2023, when the chatgPT came out, I introduced AI in my classes, and realized that students were using this tool to deceive the teachers. Students have to realize that when using AI, they are falling into a certain trap because they are not learning. It is the law of the lowest effort, equal to the phase in which the internet emerged, when students selected, copied and sent to the teacher. We now have the problem that the answers are in Brazilian Portuguese, for example, and I see soon that AI was used. We have, therefore, to dismantle this action in the heads and face them. I tell them that they are being intellectually dishonest and that they have not read the AI ​​response, for example. Since 2023, I feel that students, in the answers to this questionnaire I do, say they are afraid to use chatgpt because they are afraid of being caught by teachers. That is, it seems to have gained some conscience. It will give these lectures in a different educational context in Asia, where the use of mobile phone can be earlier. How will you deal with these differences, or do you understand that the problems of using technology in the classroom are transversal? It is a transverse question. Do we have to wonder if the use of a particular equipment and tool will make us wiser? It seems to me not, because we may have the equipment, but the use we make it varies a lot. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. I tell them that with this technology they should all have a grade 20, and that they are wasting resources, being dishonest intellectually, because they sign works that are not theirs and do not read, even, they deliver. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children. It is this “parents school” that the school can help create. We are in a moment with no return of digital, and forbidding is the most comfortable situation, but it is not the best to face reality. We have to use the right words to alert. We have in this time of alerts and consciences, encouraging the critical spirit of our students, which is little today.

Degree in Portuguese and French Teaching, Master in Pedagogical Supervision of Portuguese Teaching and Doctorate in Education Sciences, in the Specialty of Educational Technology, Adelina Moura has been developing research in the area of ​​Mobile Learning, with several publications in Portugal and abroad.
